hero.title: Flown back and forgotten: Filipino migrants face tough homecoming | Context
hero.description: Repatriated migrant workers want more government support as they struggle to rebuild their lives back in the Philippines

primary.lead: UN Report on Free Speech, Red Tagging & <abbr title="National Task Force to End Local Communist Armed Conflict">NTF-ELCAC</abbr>
primary.title: U.N. expert tells Philippines to act on media killings, abolish NTF-ELCAC
primary.description: Manila — A United Nations expert urged the Philippines on Friday to do more to curb the killings of journalists and supported abolishing an anti-communism

secondary.title: UN urges Philippines to curb killings of journalists – DW – 02/02/2024
secondary.description: The UN's rapporteur for freedom of expression has also described the so-called "red-tagging" of government critics and called for the abolition of an anti-communism task force.

secondary.title: UN expert says more needs to be done to address human rights abuses in the Philippines
secondary.description: A U.N. expert says steps have been taken under Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. to address human rights abuses such as the killings of journalists and rights activists.

secondary.title: Groups urge Marcos Jr. to heed call to abolish NTF-ELCAC
secondary.description: AlterMidya's Raymund Villanueva called on Marcos Jr. to personally address the recommendations of Irene Khan.

carousel.title: To Promise A 'Bagong Pilipinas,' Marcos Held A Concert That Cost At Least P16 Million
carousel.description: (2nd UPDATE) In Sunday's speech, Marcos said, 'Sa Bagong Pilipinas, bawal ang waldas.' The rental of tech equipment alone for the concert cost P15.9 million.

carousel.title: 5 years after its birth, Bangsamoro autonomous region struggles to control violence
carousel.description: Leader of Muslim region in Mindanao says Philippine government has been slow to fund local programs.

carousel.title: Look Through: The future of traditional jeepneys and its drivers
carousel.description: The Public Utility Vehicle Modernization Program has left many jeepney drivers and operators uncertain about their livelihood.

carousel.title: Philippine economy grew 5.6% in 2023
carousel.description: The country’s economic growth fell short of the government's target last year, largely due to higher consumer prices that discouraged spending, data from the Philippine Statistics Authority (PSA) showed.
